content.question: Much of the research regarding the function of brain areas has been gathered from case studies of individuals with brain injury or disease. Which of the following identifies a reason for this?

choices.label: Quantitative research studies cannot demonstrate cause and effect between variables.
The independent variable in an experiment would inflict brain injury, which is unethical.
There would be no relationship between an injured area of the brain and the functioning of that respective area.
It is not possible to find enough participants to conduct a proper qualitative research study.

content.answer: The independent variable in an experiment would inflict brain injury, which is unethical.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
